sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A wise and moderate discourse, concerning church-affaires. As it was written, long since, by the famous authour of those considerations, which seem to have some reference to this. Now published for the common good. Bacon, Francis, 1561-1626.
[4], 47, [1] p.
s.n.], [London : Imprinted in the yeere 1641.
"The famous authour" = Francis Bacon. Place of publication from Wing. The first leaf is blank. Variant: quire B wrongly imposed, the text for p. 2-3 interchanged with p. 6-7. Annotation on Thomason copy: "by Sr ffra: Bacon. Ld. Chancellor". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A wise and moderate discourse, concerning church-affaires. As it was written, long since, by the famous authour of those considerations, which seem to have some reference to this. Now published for the common good. Bacon, Francis, 1561-1626.
[4], 47, [1] p.
s.n.], [London : Imprinted in the yeere 1641.
"The famous authour" = Francis Bacon. Place of publication from Wing. The first leaf is blank. Variant: quire B wrongly imposed, the text for p. 2-3 interchanged with p. 6-7. Annotation on Thomason copy: "by Sr ffra: Bacon. Ld. Chancellor". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
>>>>>>> imprintparse
